original_title: Pam Bondi tightens grip on Justice Department after Epstein files fallout | CNN Politics
article_summary: Attorney General Pam Bondi reasserts control over the Justice Department, installing a new co-deputy FBI director alongside Dan Bongino, following a power struggle over the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein files. After a media lockdown due to backlash, Bondi is now focusing on President Trump's federal takeover of Washington's police force and bringing in another Trump supporter, Andrew Bailey, to the FBI, potentially signaling Bongino's exit.</s>
